summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 forwarding a letter concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The chain involves Assistant United States Attorneys, an NYPD contact, and an attorney from Marsh Law Firm, discussing the appropriate steps for the FBI to initiate contact with the victim's counsel.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The email is addressed to Audrey Strauss, an AUSA in the Southern District of New York, regarding forwarding a communication about a potential Epstein victim and coordinating an FBI interview.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: Attorney at Marsh Law Firm PLLC who sent the initial email forwarding a letter about a potential victim of Epstein and Maxwell.

connections.description: Jennifer Freeman, an attorney, forwarded a victim letter to the U.S. Attorney's office, which was then routed to AUSA Audrey Strauss for review and potential FBI action.

events.title: Forwarding of Victim Letter
events.description: An email chain is initiated forwarding a letter from a law firm concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to the U.S. Attorney's Office and NYPD.

events.title: Coordination for FBI Interview
events.description: An AUSA forwards the victim communication to the FBI, suggesting an initial interview with the victim (who is represented by counsel) and requesting coordination before contact.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A letter from a law firm regarding a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell was forwarded to U.S. authorities in November 2020.
The communication was routed from the NYPD/civilian crime reports to the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) and then to the FBI for potential interview.
The victim is represented by counsel, prompting the AUSA to request coordination before the FBI makes contact.
The document shows ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein/Maxwell victims years after the initial cases were brought.
